intro: Pomaderris vellea, commonly known as the silver-leafed pomaderris, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pomaderris vellea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in native garden landscapes.
